Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2008 03:25AM sftfemme65 wrote: This whole issue on flying and lymphedema is a confusing one.  I had 20 nodes removed a year ago and as of yet (hope it stays this way!) I do not have it.  I have taken 4 trips this year that required me to fly and I didn't have any issues.  I spoke to my onc, bs, ps and primary doctor about using a sleeve.  They all said the same thing, do not wear one if you do not have lymphedema.  In fact one of them even suggested by doing so without needing it could cause issues.  I dont know what is right or wrong honestly.  I just hope that I'm doing it right and keep an eye on my arm. Teresa
Posts.Title: lymphedema and air travel suzmarks amygil81

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2008 04:07PM sftfemme65 wrote: To clarify what I said....my bone pain started the next week.  Not right after the shot.  The ache comes from the wbc being produced so it shouldn't happen until you are low.  My aches were really not that bad at all.
Posts.Title: Bone pain in second week with Neulasta? formygirls SpecialK

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2008 04:05PM sftfemme65 wrote: I did dose dense a/c, monday treatment....tuesday shot.....bone pain usually started on monday or tuesday.  I had lab drawn on monday (week after) and my wbc was always in the toilet.  It usually takes a week for it to drop, the shot starts working after it drops. Teresa

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2008 12:52AM sftfemme65 wrote: Hi there.  No that wasnt a SNB.  I didn't have one either.  I was a like you.  I had a biopsy which showed cancer, then I went and saw a surgeon and she felt a enlarged node and did a needle biopsy in her office.  It was positive so I knew going into surgery that I needed nodes removed so there was no need for a SNB.  My understanding of the SNB is before surgery, they inject a blue dye in like four areas? on the breast, the blue dye travels to a couple nodes they are considered the sentinal nodes, can be a couple or so.  Now I do not know if its good or bad if they turn blue.  I do know that sometimes they think they are clear and after patho it turns out theyre not.  Maybe someone with a little more knowledge of this will come along. Good luck with your biopsy.  Your right Ativan is a wonderful drug.  It saved me many nights, from the anxiety.  Take care Teresa
Posts.Title: Ativan is a beautiful thing thisisme thisisme

Posts.Content: sftfemme65 wrote: I have been on Avastin since the middle of January.  Last week I went to the dentist for a cavity, the needle that they used to numb me left a bruise on my face.  I was kind of concerned but then a few days ago I lightly scratched my arm and instantly red dots appeared, little broken blood dots.  I called the nurse and insisted they check my platelets.  They were fine, 201.  Well tonight while changing I have several bruising spots and red blood dots on the side of my thigh were I itched earlier today.  I am really concerned about this and am calling the dr in the morning.  Has anyone every had this issue? I am so sick and tired of this crap Teresa Dx 11/28/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 3/20 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
